III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/30/25, Youth A was involved in an aggressive incident at the
facility. Supervisor 1 pressed their knee in Youth A’s eye when the
youth fell to the ground. Supervisor 1 also slapped Youth A in the
face. There were red markings on the Youth A’s cheek area, but
the cause is unknown.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 01/31/2025. No
additional information was provided.
Manager was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Manager reported she met
with Youth A after the incident yesterday. Youth A was upset with
Supervisor 1, so when Supervisor 1 was leaving the pod, Youth A
pushed through and got out of the Pod. Supervisor 1 was talking
to Youth A to go back to the pod and that’s when Youth A
assaulted Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 came to
assist and tried to talk to Youth A, but he refused to follow their
directive, therefore Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 attempted to
restrain him. Youth A said he fell to the floor, and they released
him. Youth A said that’s when Supervisor 1 kneed him in the eye,
and Youth A took Supervisor 1’s walkie talkie. Supervisor 1 took
the walkie talkie from Youth A and Youth A went after Supervisor
1. Supervisor 1 slapped Youth A three times. Supervisor 1 went
inside the control room, Youth A tried to get to Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 tried to again restrain Youth A.
Youth A wrapped his legs around Supervisor 2, and that’s when
he slipped and hit his head. Manager reported she did not observe
any injuries or bruising on Youth A’s face except for a scratch on
his nose. She said Youth A wears glasses and that maybe what
caused the scratch. Manager said Youth A has a history of
aggressive behavior and assaulting staff. She has a good rapport
with Youth A and most of the time can verbally de-escalate him
when he is having an episode. She said Youth A had a medical
assessment after the incident and was sent to Children’s Hospital
because he said he hit his head when he fell on the floor. She said
2

Supervisor 1 will not have any contact with Youth A pending the
investigation.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A walked into the
interview room and refused to sit down to be interviewed. An
attempt was made to question Youth A about the incident,
however he declined to answer any questions and walked out of
the interview room. A second attempt was made to interview
Youth A via telephone on 02/26/2025, in collaboration with DHHS
Specialist who was at the facility. Youth A refused to answer
questions related to the incident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported on
01/30/2025 he responded to Pod F, because Youth A wanted the
television remote control. He informed Youth A that the pod was
on punishment and could not give him the remote control yet.
That’s when Youth A came after him and pushed through the door
into the hallway. Youth A started yelling and threatening
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 approached Youth A,
and he and Supervisor 2 attempted to restrain Youth A to escort
him back to the Pod. Youth A began to punch and kick Supervisor
1. Supervisor 1 said he and Supervisor 2 attempt to do a two
person hold, however Youth A was resisting, dropped to the floor
and that’s when they released the hold. Youth A continued to kick
and assault him while he was on the floor and that’s when Youth A
took Supervisor 1’s walkie talkie. Supervisor 1 said he took the
walkie talkie from Youth A and went to the control room. Youth A
followed him into the control room, and that’s when Supervisor 2
and Supervisor 3 again attempted to restrain Youth A. Youth A
Tripped Supervisor 3, and that’s when Supervisor 3 and Youth A
fell to the floor and Youth A hit his head. Supervisor 1 denied he
or any other staff kicked, slapped, or kneed Youth A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 reported he was
walking through the hallway of Pod F, and he saw Youth A
running and yelling at Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 said Supervisor
1 was trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A, and that's when
Youth A pushed Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 1
attempted to restrain Youth A, but Youth A became more
escalated and assaultive. Youth A dropped to the floor; therefore,
he and Supervisor 1 released the hold. Youth A grabbed
Supervisor 1’s walkie talkie while he was on the floor. Supervisor
1 grabbed the walkie talkie from Youth A and went to the control
3

room. Youth A got up and followed Supervisor 1 to the control
room. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 followed Youth A to the
control room. He said they attempted to escort Youth A out of the
control room, but Youth A tripped them by sticking his foot in front
of Supervisor 3 and Supervisor 3 and Youth A fell in the control
room. Supervisor 2 said at that point Youth A calmed down and
went with Manager. Supervisor 3 denied Supervisor 1 slapped or
kneed Youth A. He denied observing any injuries on Youth A after
the incident. Supervisor 2 said Youth A came up to him today and
apologized for his behavior yesterday.
Supervisor 4 was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 4 reported he was
not directly involved in the incident, but he did observe Supervisor
1 and Supervisor 2 attempting to restrain Youth A. He saw Youth
A drop to the floor, and Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 released
the hold. Supervisor 4 denied witnessing Supervisor 1 or
Supervisor 2 slap or knee Youth A in the face.
Supervisor 5 was interviewed at the facility on 01/31/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 5 reported she
was passing snacks yesterday during the incident. She witnessed
Youth A run into the control room after Supervisor 1. She said
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 followed Youth A and escorted him
out of the control room. Supervisor 5 witnessed Youth A trip
Supervisor 3 while attempting to escort him out of the control
room. Youth A wrapped his leg around Supervisor 3 legs and
tripped Supervisor 3. She denied witnessing any staff hit or get
physical with Youth A.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via telephone on 02/13/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 3 reported on
01/30/2025, he was in the hallway when Youth A pushed through
the door when Supervisor 1 was exiting Pod F. He said he
witnessed Youth A trying to push through the second set of doors
and Supervisor 1 was attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A.
Youth A swung at Supervisor 1 and that’s when he and Supervisor
2 attempted to restrain Youth A. He said Youth A dropped to the
floor, so Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 released Youth A. Youth A
grabbed Supervisor 1’s walkie talkie while he was on the floor.
Supervisor 1 retrieved the walkie talkie and went to the control
room. He and Supervisor 2 attempted to escort Youth A back to
the Pod, but Youth A resisted and followed Supervisor 1 to the
control room. He and Supervisor 2 followed Youth A, and while
attempting to escort Youth A out of the control room, Youth A
wrapped his leg around Supervisor 3 leg’s causing Youth A and
4

Supervisor 3 to fall. Supervisor 3 denied Supervisor 1 slapped or
kneed Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 02/25/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported she was in
the hallway and witnessed Youth A push through Supervisor 1
and run out of Pod F. She said Youth A was escalated and being
argumentative with Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 was attempting to
verbally de-escalate Youth A, and that’s when Youth A swung at
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 attempted to restrain
Youth A, and that’s when Youth A dropped to the floor. Supervisor
1 and Supervisor 2 released the hold. She said Youth A continued
to kick and assault Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2. Youth A stood
up and that’s when Supervisor 1 walked away and went to the
control room. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 attempted to escort
Youth A back to the Pod, but he ran to the control room following
Supervisor 1. She said Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 ran after
Youth A and escorted him out of the control room. She witnessed
Youth A trip Supervisor 3 during the escort and fall on the floor.
She was witnessed the entire incident and at no point did any of
the supervisors hit, slap, or knee Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage for the incident was reviewed at the facility,
date of video footage was 01/30/2025 (note: video had no
audio). The video footage captured Supervisor 1 walking
out of the Pod, Youth A pushing Supervisor 1, and leaving
the pod. The video now flips to the hallway, Youth A is in
the hallway, Supervisor 1 appears to be talking to Youth A,
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 approach Youth A and
Supervisor 1. Youth A starts swinging at Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 attempt to restrain Youth A
in a two person restrain. Youth A is kicking Supervisor 1
and Supervisor 2. Youth A drops to the floor, and the hold
is released. At no point does it show Supervisor 1 kneed or
slapped Youth A. Youth A stands up and that’s when
Supervisor 1 walks away to the control room. Supervisor 2
and Supervisor 3 attempt to restrain Youth A, but he frees
himself and follows Supervisor 1 into the control room
(note: there is no cameras in the control room). Supervisor
2 and Supervisor 3 follow Youth A into the control room. A
few seconds later Youth A exits the control room with
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident report dated 01/30/25, written by Manager
for youth assaulting staff, physical restraint, and medical.
Report is consistent with Manager interview.
• Medical record from Children’s Hospital dated 01/30/2025.
Youth A was examined due to falling and hitting his head.
Youth A exam was normal except for a superficial abrasion
to the scalp, no bleeding.
• Supervisor 1 has two disciplinary action plan records in
2023. The first for using telephone in the control room and
the second one is for time and attendance. Staff 1
completed MANDT verbal and de-escalation and physical
skills training on 08/15/2024 and 08/22/2024.
• Physical management policy states that restraints may be
used when the youth is in the act of assaulting other
persons or jeopardizing the safety of others.
• Youth Discipline & Behavior Modification Policy states any
type of physical discipline is prohibited. The use of verbal
and non-physical crisis intervention should be utilized first
and may prevent the need for physical intervention. A youth
initiating physical contact with a staff or another person with
the intent of controlling or harming that person and/or picks
up something to use as a weapon is considered a physical
assault. The appropriate staff response is to use a safe
physical management procedure to control the youth and
then use the Behavior Management Procedure until the
youth is under physical and emotional control.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff interviews, video
footage, and documentations reviewed. There is insufficient
evidence that Youth A was kneed or slapped by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted following an allegation that a supervisor at the Lincoln Center juvenile facility kneed and slapped a youth during a physical altercation on January 30, 2025. The investigation, which included interviews with multiple staff and the youth (who refused to answer questions), review of video footage (without audio and with no camera in a key room), and medical records, found insufficient evidence to substantiate the youth's claims. While the report concludes no violation was established, the incident involved a youth with a history of aggression and a physical restraint that resulted in a hospital visit, highlighting a volatile situation. The weight of the staff's consistent accounts against the uncooperative youth's initial allegation leads to a finding of no formal culpability, though the altercation itself points to systemic challenges in managing such incidents.
